Class WorldRelation

All Implemented Interfaces:
com.telenav.kivakit.core.string.AsIndentedString, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.Indexed, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.LongKeyed, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.naming.Named, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.DoubleQuantizable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.Quantizable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.numeric.QuantumComparable<com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.collection.Indexed>, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.string.Stringable, com.telenav.kivakit.interfaces.string.StringSource, com.telenav.kivakit.validation.Validatable, com.telenav.mesakit.map.geography.shape.rectangle.Bounded
public class WorldRelation extends com.telenav.mesakit.graph.EdgeRelation
An relation in a WorldGraph, scoped by a WorldCell and having a WorldRelationIdentifier. The cell for this graph element can be retrieved with worldCell() and an override of the identifier() method from EdgeRelation returns the WorldRelationIdentifier for the relation. The members() method is overridden to ensure that WorldRelationMembers are returned which are scoped by cell.

Note that there are two methods to retrieve the graph of this GraphElement. The GraphElement.graph() method overrides GraphElement.graph() to return the WorldGraph that contains this element, while the GraphElement.subgraph() method returns the graph where the element is actually stored (the cell sub-graph of the world graph).

Author:
jonathanl (shibo)
